issue.title: P0653 + P1006 should have made the other std::to_address overload constexpr

discussion.p: While reviewing some interactions with P0653 + P1006, Billy discovered that one of the overloads was missing the constexpr tag. This might be a typo or a missed merge interaction between P0653 (which adds to_address with the pointer overload being constexpr) and P1006 (which makes pointer_traits::pointer_to constexpr). Mail was sent the LWG reflector, and Glen Fernandes, the author of P0653, indicates that this might have been an oversight.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4842.

blockquote.pre: template<class Ptr> constexpr auto to_address(const Ptr& p) noexcept;

blockquote.p: -3- Returns: pointer_traits<Ptr>::to_address(p) if that expression is well-formed (see ), otherwise to_address(p.operator->()).
